title: ICE “unexpected bound ty in binder” involving type binder, `Fn`-family trait and closure

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rs #![feature(non_lifetime_binders)] fn take(_: impl for FnOnce(T) -> T) {} fn main() { take(|x| x) } ``` ### Error output ``` warning: the feature `non_lifetime_binders` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> take_id.rs:1:12 | 1 | #![feature(non_lifetime_binders)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #108185 for more information = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default error: internal compiler error: /rustc/ac4379fea9e83465d814bb05005689f49bd2141e/compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/fold.rs:297:33: unexpected bound ty in binder: BoundTy { var: 0, kind: Anon(0) } thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/ac4379fea9e83465d814bb05005689f49bd2141e/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1644:9 ```
